page.title: 03Life in The Block.
page.content: The ironworks is all but gone and much of the area has or is being cleared and new housing being built.But people are trying to keep some of the old buildings like the famous Dowlais stables where the horses that worked in the ironworks were kept. The third part of our block is the village of Pantscallog ("thistle dingle").apart from some new housing estates on its outskirts the village has hardly changed.Its houses were built mainly before 1900. with the Caeracca Farm house marked 1776. The village was once surrounded by farms but many of these have now gone Close by is Brecon Beacons National Park and a narrow gauge railway runs from the village into the park.There are also plans to build a motel in the area so making it a tourist area. It is indeed a block of contrasts.
